General 
 - Exercise diligence in the prevention of mosquito bites 
 - Treat sexual intercourse with caution, due to risk of transmission 

Clothing 
 - Wear long-sleeved shirts and long pants 
 - Treat clothing and gear with permethrin or purchase permethrin-treated items; treated clothing remains protective after multiple washings but do NOT use permethrin products directly on skin 

Indoor Protection 
 - Stay in places with either air conditioning or window and door screens in order to keep mosquitoes outside 
 - If neither of these amenities are available (or you are sleeping outdoors), a mosquito bed net makes a serviceable form of protection 

Repellent 
 - Use Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)-registered insect repellents: when used as directed, these insect repellents are safe and effective for everyone, including pregnant and breastfeeding women 
 - Always follow the product label instructions when using repellent or similar products 
 - Reapply as directed 
 - Do not spray repellent on the skin under clothing, as they can be either toxic or acidic on application 
 - If you are also using sunscreen, apply sunscreen BEFORE applying insect repellent 
 - Use a repellent with one of the following active ingredients: DEET, picaridin, IR3535, and oil of lemon eucalyptus or paramenthandiol (PMD)
